page.title: 08Wildlife
page.content: The area is a positive haven for both flora and fauna because of its relatively unspoilt and undeveloped landscape and also because of the wide variety of habitat from open fell to heavy deciduous woodland. Birds seen on one day include Gooseander, Tree Creeper, Merlin, Buzzard, Peregrine Falcon, Yellow Hammer, Lesser Spotted Woodpecker, Greater Spotted Woodpecker, Siskin, heron and Tawny Owl as well as many more common species. Animals seen in the area include Daubentons Bat, Long-Eared Bat, Otter, Badger, Deer, Stoats, Weasel, Pipistrelle Bat, Marten, Fox and Hare. There are many rare species of plant in the area, some of which are highly protected species.
